summary.p: The Clone Results tool window provides you with a list of clone class search results.
To access Clone Results, select Clone Results on the View - Other Windows menu.

section.title: Representation
section.p: The searches are triggered by some other window, e.g. by using Clone Intersections or the code editor.
Each result is contained in a tab of its own. The header shows the ID of searched clone class.
In the sample above the clone class 227 contains clones in three files.

The bar charts show a graphical representation of the file content and clone distribution. The wider the bar, the more source code the file contains. Instead of displaying the content in top-down fashion, the bars are displayed left-right. That means that the first line is at the left side while the last line is at the right side. Since all clones belong to the same clone class all clones are colored in a single color, which is purple.
For the sample above this provides you with the following pieces of information:

ul.li: MethodInvocationExpression.cs is the biggest file but it is not much larger than FunctionInvocationExpression.cs.
All occurrences of the clone class 227 are in the upper part of a file.

section.title: Navigation
section.p: The Clone Results tool window allows you to easily open the files and navigate to the duplicated source code. For this you only have to right click the file. In the context menu you see all clones contained in that file. Click the clone you want to open.
The file will be opened in the code editor and the cloned source code is selected.
section.note: Double clicking the file will open it and select the first clone. This is handy for files that only contain one clone.
